episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a range of fascinating topics, including the historical size of rats, the skiing habits of Pope John Paul II, the mass moving day tradition in New York, and the mystery of why humans kiss.

facts.fact: Rats were once the size of hippos.
During his 27-year run as Pope, John Paul II took over 100 ski vacations.
A hundred years ago, a quarter of the residents of New York would move house every single May the 1st at exactly 9 a.m.
